column1: Masty (Belarusian: Масты; Lithuanian: Mastai) or Mosty (Russian: Мосты́; Polish: Mosty) is a city in Grodno Region
column3: the administrative centre of Masty District.

column1: Within the Grand Duchy of Lithuania
column2: Masty was part of Trakai Voivodeship. In 1795
column3: Masty was acquired by the Russian Empire as a result of the Third Partition of Poland.

column2: Masty was part of the Second Polish Republic. In September 1939
column3: the town was occupied by the Red Army and

column2: Masty was occupied by Nazi Germany and administered as a part of Bezirk Bialystok.
